website_summaries.verdict: A large and flexible bag with removable pouches, so you can choose the amount of storage space you need.
pros: 3 detachable pouches for extra storage capacity
Folds up when not in use
Padded back for added comfort, even when carrying a lot of gear
cons: Users say it's difficult to keep the straps of the bag cinched tightly

customer_reviews.title: Keep on packing!
customer_reviews.text: I love this backpack. Im heading on a 2 month backpacking trip to Europe. I am packing 2 sweatpants, 2 jeans, 3 big sweaters for winter. I am also bringing 12 shirts, 8 underwear (I will be adding more now), 9 socks. Furthermore, I'm bringing a laptop, charger, mouse, mouse pad, hygiene stuff, portable charger, water bottle, adapter, inflatable pillow, and a few more stuff. All of it fits here. Here i am putting a video i recorded before i was done packing. I am leaving in 2 days, and im glad i was able to pack everything i wanted and then some more here. I hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for the price
customer_reviews.text: I am a tactical firearms Instructor and I use a tactical bag to carry my laptops, books, and materials in. I have been looking for a larger pack that is not overly large. This bag appeared to have all that I wanted except built in velcro peices for my patches. Because this bag is reasonably priced, I took a chance on it. I am glad that I did. This is a roomy pack that is comfortable to carry. It seems well made and very sturdy. It did take me some time to sew in a velcro piece for my patch because the material is thick but it worked well. NOTE THE PATCH IN THE PICTURE IS SOLD SEPARATE.
customer_reviews.author: james massey

customer_reviews.title: Bought 5 - should have bought 5 more
customer_reviews.text: These backpacks are great for survival, emergency response, get out pack etc. For those that have used 3 day pack in the military, these are even better because of the flexibility in size and detachable parts that would generally be attached with molle gear. There is space for a camelback as well. Love this pack.
customer_reviews.author: Heather S.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Like others have said, this pack is not the quality you find in a much more expensive pack, but it's only 30 bucks! There is ample room and compartments for all your gear or gadgets. There is a detachable pack with belt attachment for quick excursions. Plenty of slots and pockets to organize your gear. I have no doubt this pack will have room to spare for my boating/fishing excursions. Good quality for the pricepoint.
customer_reviews.author: N. G. Feb

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Didn't come with extra pouches, there is no way it's a 50L bag unless the count those pouches too. Shoulder straps are secured 4 inches down from the top of bag which makes it sit funny on your back, making the waist strap more of a stomach strap. The straps also have no stop sewn in, and pull out every time you try and tighten them. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Gridguy

customer_reviews.title: ATTENTION SELLER: Clip broke on first use!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed getting this cool looking tactical backpack. After packing my bug out bag I attempted to put on the pack only to see the front chest clip break after unclipping it. :( I would like to keep this backpack. Hopefully the seller can replace it with another one or send me a new clip. Please help correct this faulty product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Not a rugged bag at all. I bought this to carry stuff to work like my hazmat suit full face respirator etc... the material is very thin, the straps are anemic at best but it was only 33 bucks but I should have paid the extra 40 and gotten a better one.. this one wont last me long.. but for your kids after school gear it would be good.. Cvlife has made some pretty good stuff in the past items I've bought.. but for what it is I guess I'll just use till it falls apart pack...
customer_reviews.author: demized empire

customer_reviews.title: The problem with this back-pack is the waist-band is too short!
customer_reviews.text: The problem with this back-pack is the waist-band is too short! I have a 34-inch waist and I could barey get it to clasp. I had to sew on a military-service-belt which was fully-adjustable. WHY? if you are only wearing a t-shirt you might be able to clasp the waist-belt. If wearing any jackets or coats it would be impossible. Otherwise, the design is good and I've numerous molle packs attached to it already. Shoulder straps are suitably-functional. Because of the material it is a heavy pack when empty as my twenty-year-old son had expressed. I told him inthe USMC we carried packs 90-100-lbs always. Get used to it! - jfm
customer_reviews.author: John Michael

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Item broke after two uses Buckle snapped in half overall it is crap. It looks like some one went on a buckle Binge and made every strap with a buckle the buckle that holds the shoulder strap snapped after 2 uses. This item was useful until it broke. If a buckle can snap that easy and it is used for gear and other things. I am glad I was not out when it did that would have been worse.
customer_reviews.author: Sha

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Bargain...
customer_reviews.text: I do A lot of research. I love Quality especially at A bargain Price. So Many choices, I Hope this helps your Choices? I bought one and loved It so much. I Bought Another as A Gift. Too Many positive Things too Say about the Sack check it out. Matches Description on Details. It’s Not a 200.00$ backpack. But Certainly Competes right up There!!! Very good Quality! Okay that Being Said... the second Backpack Had a Small Issue... I notified cvlife directly they Didn’t Hesitate To Send A Replacement on the Spot... Awesome Customer Service And A Quality Bargain... I Recommend This Product!!!
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Beware the zips....
customer_reviews.text: this seemed a versatile well made bag, lots of pockets and a decent layout. could get a lot of items in hear and well organized. The downs, the straps are short, don't plan on wearing this over more than a light jacket, and forget it if you weigh more than average. The zips are awful, cheaply made and I had one pull apart before the bag even got out of the house. Can't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Craig J Hadfield

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Zippers broke first day. Zippers can't be repaired. None of the straps are stitched at the bottom so they slide thru the buckles. The bag will literally fall off your back. Purchased 8 of them for a Boy Scout trip. All 8 are completely unusable. They have a one year guarantee but pawn you off on Amazon for the return. Amazon will charge you to restock them!!
customer_reviews.author: David W. Green

customer_reviews.title: Roomy but fell apart months later
customer_reviews.text: Love this pack. It is lite and roomy for all your stuff. BUT the loops on the outside did crack and disintegrate last week. They are all fraying. I only use it once every 4 weeks, so its not from heavy use. It is kept indoors, in my cupboard, so its not from the weather. I will keep using it till it all falls apart. I guess you get what you pay for. Updated Jan 2020. I still love this pack. So does my kid who took it to a week long camp. Both zippers broke! so sad. Now its in a pile.
customer_reviews.author: Demar

customer_reviews.title: Good pack, good price, options a plenty.
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of space, compression straps, modular options and appears initially to be quite well made. The backpack looks a little odd without the lower fanny pack segment attached. Not all of the straps for the buckles came with the strap end stitched over themselves to prevent buckles from sliding off, but some did... weird. Also don't really care for the small saddle bags attached, but I can find other uses for those little ditty bags easy enough. Not a lot of use just yet, so I'll update my review if anything changes. For now a solid 4 stars... good product, good price.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Foster

customer_reviews.title: It works and is roomy, but could be better built
customer_reviews.text: This pack is a great 3-day pack. it has plenty of room, is water resistant, and has a good pad built in to keep your back happy. It has plenty of straps for attachment of extra bags or tools. The detachable buttpack is roomy enough to use separately as a waist or shoulder pack (or even a first aid kit). The only issue after having this for several weeks is the straps are sewn in with barely any extra threading, so the strap loops seem prone to pull out. They can be sewn back in place fairly easily, but a decent overlap and X pattern of sewing would have been much better.
customer_reviews.author: Greg M.

customer_reviews.title: Good bag with lots of space, but has some serious issues.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very big bag with lots of storage. Very versatile. Cons: the adjustment straps are awful and slip out!!! It's a bit bizarre to wear because there are straps everywhere. Gets tangled up. Accessory compartments are a bit floppy when attached. Zippers are stiff and awkward. Overall, it's good. You'll want to replace the adjustment/compression straps with something with grip. Would be very easy to overload yourself with this large bag. But, if you want lots of space for your stuff, go for it. For the price, though, it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Lane

customer_reviews.title: Its a Bag.
customer_reviews.text: We got this backpack for our son for Christmas. In using it, it is nice, has a good quality (so far) and seems like it might hold up for a little while. I zippers on this bag are very stiff, but that will work in after awhile. The main compartment is large and very deep. After putting in all the school books, there was still enough room in the bag to put in a jacket in the empty space. Even though it was not spacious enough to hold all the books and notebooks at once, I feel this bag will do the trick. Only time will tell how well it will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Mike L.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality for the price!!!
customer_reviews.text: I paid $30 for a ruggad pack and I've only used it for maybe 2 months and it rips ALREADY! MAYBE if I hiked with it but I just use it to bring my things to and from work, and that's all!!!! NOT HAPPY!!!! I didnt get a discount but seems as though I got a discounted (cheap) item!!!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Ellixson

customer_reviews.title: Great look but very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a great looking backpack and I was attracted to the ability to manipulate it for multiple purposes; classic backpack, waist pack, side pockets, chest strap, etc. I used this backpack 4 times. On the third, on of the two major zippers came unfastened and was unusable. On the fourth, through airports this week, I noticed that the stitching of the major outside compartment had come unraveled on both ends. I had to buckled straps around the pack to keep my belongings from falling out everywhere. I dearly wanted to love this pack, but I fell for a good look and very poor quality. It’s now in my city’s landfill
customer_reviews.author: Matt C

customer_reviews.title: Good pack for a bugout bag bit too big for a get home bag
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a well made pack, large zipper pulls allowing their use with gloves on. multiple detachable pouches with webbing and a molle panel to accommodate even more pouches as needed. So far it has survived being drug around the family ranch with me and/or being thrown in the back seat of my vehicle when I go into town, it is kept packed as a bugout bag along with a fully stocked med kit in an M3 styled bag which is kept tied off underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen D. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Looking for a tactical bag? Look no further
customer_reviews.text: Pretty durable backpack - EXTREMELY tactical. If you are looking for a tactical bag that has plenty of space, then look no further. It is a little heavier than I expected and I do not know how to utilize all of the buckles and attachments. It's not my favorite but it definitely gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Judice

customer_reviews.title: 4 out of 5 Ain't Bad at All
customer_reviews.text: A little small for my body size/frame (which I sort of figured before purchase anyway), but the size issue is not so much a problem as to render the sack totally useless for my needs. While I saw some comments that include photos of a less than perfect quality rucksack, I am impressed with the quality of rucksack "I received"..... My rucksack (black) has no rips, no irregularities, and nothing to piss me off or make me regret the purchase, or lead me to demand a refund. In my opinion, the item (black rucksack) I received, was a good quality rucksack for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: David in Florida

customer_reviews.title: MADE IN CHINA
customer_reviews.text: For $31 i got what i paid for. Its roomy so im gona fill it with emergency supplies, food bandages gauz spare change of clothes etc. and throw it in my trunk. U can fit a small toddler in it ( or 2 infants) thats not recommended. Youre not paying for quality, youre paying for storage space. Its perfect for the price. If you want more you have to pay for more. I dont expect to survive the apocalypse, i just wana live longer than my enemies and this bags got enough space for a months worth of supplies. Ill be more prepared than my whole town. Also its made in china soooo...
customer_reviews.author: Happy moses

customer_reviews.title: The stitchings are not durable at all ☹️
customer_reviews.text: I've had this bag only for 8 months and I use it mainly for my carry on bag for travel and it was actually at six months that I started noticing the stitches in the main bag and some of the smaller molly bags start separating and not just a little either. A bag being advertised as a treckkey or outdoors use is completely misleading, I've purchased backpacks from retailers for less in cost but was only about 30/40 liter has lasted me much longer and has endured much more use. Very disappointed, won't buy again and don't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Krzy Munky

customer_reviews.title: So much room
customer_reviews.text: Purchase two of these to use as emergency bags as we live in a high fire area. We were able to put all of our gear in their plus more! There is a lot of room in these bags and they are sturdy. Of course I've loaded my bag way too much and probably couldn't hike a mile with it... But I can throw it in my car and have everything I need available. We are loving our bags.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpack
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of room, comfortable, well made, reasonably priced! What more can I say? Oh, I do wish they offered 2 more of the large side bags to put above the 2 that are already there. Aside from that, Its Perfect! ( for me anyway )Also, they could tell you how many cubic inches of space it has in addition to liters. Seems most Americans are metric illiterate...
customer_reviews.author: Mike Kell

customer_reviews.title: Not As Durable As It Appears
customer_reviews.text: This backpack looks good. It appears to be strong and sturdy. It is spacious and versatile with detachable side pockets. But, the durability of the material and stitching may be questionable (see pictures). It fell apart from only six months of daily use: consisting of a thermos, some maps, lunch, and snacks. It was only transferred from home, to car, to truck and back home. Never used it for hiking or extended travel purposes. Given its short lifespan, I would not recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonist

customer_reviews.title: So much storage
customer_reviews.text: This bag weighs a little more than similar sized bag but that is because of the durable material that its made of. To me thats a plus that its durable. The extra weight isin't awful but if you have had other bags you'll probably notice it like I did. I think that this is a great overall bag for a few overnights in the outdoors or even a week or a little more depending on what and how you pack. Lots of storage and Ive had no issue with the zips.
customer_reviews.author: Silentwolf Adventures

customer_reviews.title: Rough and Tough
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this bag for about 2 years now and it is still holding up as good as the first day I got it. This bag as been VERY abused. I put my tools in one pocket. Screwdriver, Pliers, Flashlight, Hex Wrenches, Needle Nose and ect. There is not one hole poked in that part of the bag. I throw all my personal stuff in my self declared Man's Purse. It goes in and out of my big truck everyday with no problems. If I am able to destroy this one. I promise to get another one.
customer_reviews.author: E Clay

customer_reviews.title: the price tell you the quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm looking for a large molle backpack for the summer trip. Saw this one on sale (less then $21), read reviews before I put the order. The delivery was on time. But following are the immediately jump into my mind after I opened the box: 1. That's not a 60L backpack. Might be a size of 45~50L. 2. A couple of sewing are off the line. No wonder one of reviewer said it broken after his first time use. The quality of the sewing is very poor. I doubt it can hold on more than 20 lbs 3. I will not even want to give it a try. I returned it in the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Robz

customer_reviews.title: Zipper pulls failed after 15 months ownership and about 6 uses.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a nice heavy pack with attachment points for day hikes. Rarely filled it to the top. Didn't overload the weight and the zipper pulls on one of the large main compartments have come off the zipper so it no longer closes the compartment. This happened while out on the trail which would have been more inconvenient if it didn't have the 2 straps that run from the shoulder straps to the back of the backpack. It made the return hike very uncomfortable having the shoulder straps pulled back like they were. Will be looking at other brands for replacement.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rothery

customer_reviews.title: Nice roomy pack
customer_reviews.text: Over all a very roomy buggout bag. The detachable lower FAFK (First Aid Field Kit) pouch is really room and I was impressed with the amount of Firstaid stuff it can hold. The whole inside of the bag, and all pouches are lined with a water proof coating, which is a major plus. Nothing worse than getting to your site and finding soggy undies. You get my drift. The biggest issue I have with this pack , is the straps. There just not wide enuff, and there's just not alot of padding.making this purely a buggout bag and not for hiking long distances...
customer_reviews.author: Louis Schiller

customer_reviews.title: Multiple Zipper Failures
customer_reviews.text: After only one use I am returning this back to the supplier. While packing one of the zippers on the outside pouch failed, but I was able to fix it with a pair of pliers. During the trip, when we were repacking, the main pouch zipper failed multiple times, even after the zipper was repaired. Based on the repetitive zipper failures, I have lost complete trust and confidence in the construction of this bag and am returning it for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Grumpy Old Marine

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product glad I bought it on sale. I love the design layout, but the quality and construction is poor, also the zippers being all metal are very noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bug out bag
customer_reviews.text: For the price point this is a great backpack if you don’t use it regularly. I imagine if it was day to day you would run across some wear, but it’s cheap! Makes a great bug out bag for me.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Otto

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH IT
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my trip to NYC to be able to carry things while I walked around the city. Things like an additional shirt, water and some personal items. The weight amount could not have been more than 15lbs in the bag, but on my second day of traveling the stitching had already come undone on two parts of the right shoulder strap making it very uncomfortable on the right side. This was very frustrating as this is supposed to be a tough built outdoor type of backpack and didn't even last two days.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Colletti

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Worth Buying
customer_reviews.text: Great backpack/ carrier of all things that'll fit inside you could put a lot of clothes or stuff in here. Tons of pockets, looks cool. Feels strong. There's an abundance of space in this backpack for a normal person that's not filling it too travel or camp all the time. Although good feature too have if you really need it. Definitely WORTH THE MONEY
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Rios

customer_reviews.title: Great if you want broken shoulder straps.
customer_reviews.text: I had this for about 2 weeks. It took a crap this morning (7/18/2019) when I tried to take it off my back. I had maybe 50 lbs of stuff at the most, but as soon as I got one strap off, the other snapped clean off. It fit a lot of my backpacking kit in it. It failed within 2 weeks. I am greatly disappointed in the construction of this bag. It feels solid until you try to load it like a rucksack. It's overall garbage. You are better off saving the extra money for a military rucksack.
customer_reviews.author: Quentin Pittman

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly fine, just don’t put a ton of weight in
customer_reviews.text: Bought in June, and probably shouldn’t have put as much weight in it as I have... But out of the box, it was losing a lot of the stitching, and the first trip caused the liner to begin cracking and peeling. It’s still in the contents as it fails. Will just use til it falls apart, just hoping I don’t break anything important when it does fail.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I've been looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this bag, especially for the price. I would expect to pay 3 times as much for these features and quality. There is plenty of room, I love the modular aspect of the side pockets and back pouch. The tie loops on the bottom are perfect for extra gear. The material is quite rugged when compared with similar priced bags which seem to be thinner and thinner nylon all the time. I've been looking for a bag like this, at a price I can afford for years. My only regret is that I didn't buy two, but I can fix that shortly.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Troyer

customer_reviews.title: Large and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Lots of room for gear etc. I purchased two of these. Unfortunately, the black bag arrived with only one tactical pouch. Also when using, you may want to consider tacking down or sewing the shoulder strap buckles as they can sometimes slide out, which is a pain. Otherwise I would have given it 4-5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: EHotchkiss

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Materials.
customer_reviews.text: I was optimistic about this bag but after less than a month the main zipper failed. Yes, it is a $30 bag and I should have purchased smarter.
customer_reviews.author: John J. Baich

customer_reviews.title: Not up to par
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use daily on my excursions when I got it looked inside and was not happy with the lineing and zippers I would over load it and thought that something would give either zippers or interior would tear didn’t wanna take a chance with it and 3 months later rip tare
customer_reviews.author: D nutz

customer_reviews.title: SO MUCH ROOM
customer_reviews.text: has pockets and pouches for everything. I use this for travel and work so, for instance, when TSA wants my snacks separated, I can just detach one side pouch and send that through. Zippers are solid, main pouch is enormous. Shoulder straps have so much adjustment and are comfortable even at 50+ lbs. can handle being stuffed and heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Rugged backpack is durable and
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backpack for my 12 year old grandson never dreaming that I was buying something that will last him for many years to come. I like to feel that my dollars are well spent and this purchase was extremely satisfying. The quality and durability of the well made bag far exceeded my hope. He is also a boy scout and often camps and hikes. This rugged bag will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Tuskerfriend

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Chinese junk that rips and tears apart right away
customer_reviews.text: Cheap Chinese crap do not buy it save your money every Stitch is already ripping and it's been a week this is the worst backpack I've ever seen or bought and used f****** pathetic
customer_reviews.author: Josh Piety

customer_reviews.title: lots of space and useful pockets, but zipper quality not great
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the size of this bag and all the storage options it provides with the removable side packs. The only thing I did not like is the zipper was very stiff, it did not zip well. I packed the bag with plenty of space remaining and when I went to zip up, the zipper ripped off at the seam where it would connect together. There is still a zipper on the other side that can be used, but I am not certain that will not fail as well. Will most likely be returning.
customer_reviews.author: SHASTA H.

customer_reviews.title: Good bag for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Some fitment issues but overall a good large modular bag for light users. This is not a high speed open/close bad or one that will do good hitting the ground often. Looks like a small ruck. Key word "look". Should do fine for average home or light camping. I use mine to keep camera gear in one bag. I do not carry this thing but to the car or office.
customer_reviews.author: Jaysa Bookwalter

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack, great price!
customer_reviews.text: Lots of room in the main two compartments and the addition of the smaller bags really allows you to get things organized. Heavy duty materials and zippers ensure this bag will last a long, long time. CVLife has an outstanding eye for quality. I will recommend them to my friends and will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Betty A. Massengill

customer_reviews.title: Looks cool but it's cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I used this bag every day for nearly a month. I loaded it with my gaming laptop and peripherals, as well as my bike tools, my Bible, my sketchbook, and some clothes when I moved to Kansas. Before I left Cali, I noticed it was starting to fray in spots, and I knew it wasn't gonna last... Sure enough, while riding down a dirt road, one of the straps snapped. I had to jury rig it the rest of the way. Best thing about this bag is the appearance. Skip it.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Taylor

customer_reviews.title: horrible knock off
customer_reviews.text: when i received this product it was nothing like what the profile showed. the bag was poorly made and not even the correct material. stay far away form this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Cyborg762

customer_reviews.title: This is a terrific backpack!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pack last week and I'm very pleased with it. It's much larger than I was expecting, which I was happy about. It has so many compartments which makes it easier to organize my gear. I know some of the reviews are not as positive as mine but I haven't had any of the problems listed in those reviews. Is it a pack that I'd count on lugging 40 pounds around everyday, no. But for the weekenders like me, it's perfect. For under 30 bucks, I'd buy it every time.
customer_reviews.author: Lott

customer_reviews.title: Zippers broke on maiden voyage.
customer_reviews.text: Ok. So this bag looks great and it holds a lot of items. BUT the zipper broke on not just 1 but BOTH that I bought for my kids camping gear. AND it was the first time they took it anywhere. I am very disappointed as I was hoping these would last for our adventures years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I’m enjoying this pack so far. I bought it to be able to RIC with some weight on my back as a good way to get some exercise. It’s working well so far. I started out with about 20 pounds and it was comfortable on a 4 mile hike once I got the straps adjusted the way I wanted. I have a small torso and I was able to adjust it to be comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, exceptional considering the price
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy after a couple uses, color fades fast, not real molle, everything it has works fine and it’s zippers and seams are well made and it’s Held up 3 years now just fine. Lots of pockets and storage space is nice for a weekend bag.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality, the straps dont even have a lip to prevent them from coming out of the clip they pull right out. Mine arrived dirty likenit was pulled out of a dark dusty corner then poorly wrapped in plastic and tape. As a former military member for 12 years I can honestly say this is nothing close to military quality as described
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: If your prior service looking for a good pack for whatever keep looking this is not it. Straps are paper thin, thin stitching would not hold up to rigorous work and training. Only pro is that it is a good size bag way bigger than a assault pack.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg D

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This backpack looks good in the pictures, but beware. It is made of a very flimsy material. It looks like the same material as the free, reusable shopping bags they give away as a promotion. I gave it away to someone for free. It will not last for every day use.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, very flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Very flimsy product. It’s probably good for a child or maybe a Boy Scout, not for the real world.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than a week.  would give less than 1 star if possible.
customer_reviews.text: After using this pack for less than a week i am returning it due to the bottom one of the shoulder straps ripping out and leaving a hole in the main compartment and rendering that strap completely unusable. was hoping to use this as an bug out type bag but it is complete junk.
customer_reviews.author: Ingsoc 1984

customer_reviews.title: Not Durabe
customer_reviews.text: I have had my bag for a few months after about a month and a half the straps ripped off the the bag zippers wouldn't work and stitching was coming unraveled everywhere. I use this bag for commuting to and from work so I dont recommend this bag for any regular use
customer_reviews.author: Bromista Davis

customer_reviews.title: Nice pack, poor snaps
customer_reviews.text: Pack itself is roomy and decent. No Velcro for patches if you’re expecting that like on some packs. Loss of stars is the snaps holding the “fanny” pack on came off immediately on one strap, rendering it unusable as an attachment. Other than that it is very roomy and usable...
customer_reviews.author: CARush

customer_reviews.title: It's tactical!
customer_reviews.text: I'm big, it's a good size the chest snap is too tight and high but overall it doesn't look like a child's backpack on me. Plus as some guy asked me at work, "is it tactical?" I replied, "why yes, I use it for all my missions, like coming to the office and carrying my snacks and pens." Great buy for me. Strap brackets could be tighter fitting on the straps...yeah...
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Good pack, zipper failed early on.
customer_reviews.text: Zipper on one of the main compartments failed on first use. There are two zippers, so I am still able to close the bag using the other zipper. But given the overall feel of the bag, I thought it was better quality than immediate zipper failure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Zippers are junk
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't going to complain based on the price, but you should know the zippers on this thing are extremely cheap. Third time I opened the large compartment, the zipper head jumped right off. Spend the extra money and get something that works.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B

customer_reviews.title: Durable, good deal for price
customer_reviews.text: Bought on a sale, about 6 months ago. I expected a compromised pack at this price (especially compared to other similar bags) but am very pleased. Much more durable than I expected. Stiff, thick fabric and bigger style zippers. Used for work (me, 6'1") and for occasional backpack trips (son, 5'2"). Adjustable for both. More than enough volume to surpass what you can carry comfortably. Took off the fanny pack and belt for daily use. Side pockets work well for thermos/water bottle/20 oz contigo. Does have a sleeve for laptops but haven't used it for that. I expect it to last for many years at this pace.
customer_reviews.author: TxAngus

customer_reviews.title: Feels cheep, Fell apart
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this product, it not only feels cheep when used in a military setting this product LITERALLY fell apart. The front pouch that attaches is the only part I have retained, the rest I threw out by the 2nd month having it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Balch

customer_reviews.title: Great Price, Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I ised this backpack for a month while hiking in Montana and the Tetons. I had close to 40 pounds of rocks and gear. I subjected this thing to very rugged terrain and wear and tear. Held up beautifully. Lots of hooks and clips to attach things to. The detachable side and lower bags were a fantastic feature. Would highly recommend! Its still going strong
customer_reviews.author: Malek Ismail

customer_reviews.title: Perfect B.O.B.
customer_reviews.text: Got this bag earlier today to replace my tired old B.O.B. I was definitely not disappointed. There is a substantial amount of room in the main bag and the small detachable bags. The zippers are robust and appear durable. The material is strong and the stitching appears solid. The straps have plenty of adjustment which is usually a concern for me since I'm a larger man (50R jacket). The only thing I would like to have seen is a Velcro area for morale patches but that's a quick easy fix and not worth removing a star for.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse M.

customer_reviews.title: Not Tactical ... It's Craptical!
customer_reviews.text: I wish this was made with quality and pride. This thing is a total shiz sandwich. I think Fisher Price has better options for a quality tactical backpack. I think it was probably designed and put together from a libtard rooster fish.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bateman

customer_reviews.title: roomy & comfy shoulder straps
customer_reviews.text: kinda cheating on my review cuz i haven't actually packed every emergency kit item in it. it's roomy & has comfy shoulder straps. wait, even if i pack it & write a review i'd still be kinda cheating cuz i bought it for bugging out. will it stand up to perhaps bouncy travel on foot? to the elements? to a tug-o-war? to be continued...
customer_reviews.author: just a regular gal

customer_reviews.title: Zippers will fall off consistently.
customer_reviews.text: It's been just shy of 2 months with this bag. As just a bag it's okay. Zippers keep coming off because they're cheaply made. After they fall off, I literally bend them open with my bare hands with little effort, reinsert them on the track and squeeze them closed again. Plenty of space internally and lots of pockets. Also lots of straps to tighten from different load points. Haven't gotten it wet yet, wouldn't trust it tho.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Barber

customer_reviews.title: Sew the straps at the end and you have a decent pack
customer_reviews.text: This pack Is good for the money. The only thing that should be done to give it 5 stars it to sew the ends of the straps up so they don’t pull through. If you’re looking for heavy duty straps heavy duty buckles this is not the pack for you. Like I said for the money it’s good and you could get by with it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Swann

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable and Functional.  Wouldn't buy again but seems to late to return.
customer_reviews.text: This product looks very functional online, but when you actual use it for what it is designed for, it becomes very uncomfortable and does not meet the need of a back. I was finally able to take it on a hike and discovered the shoulder strap is in a very awkward place thus making the weight of any items in the pack undistributed and uncomfortable to wear. The design must be better. Now I have to look for a new back pack.
customer_reviews.author: linda

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: The material seemed thinner than I was expecting, but then again, it wasn't the most expensive bag on the market. Lots of pockets, and the straps are pretty solid. The zippers seem to be pretty sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Lane N. Halterman

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I took this bag out once to go hiking. And failed. The zippers broke right away. There was no back support on it. Threw back pack straps dug into my arm pits. It wasn't a great back pack. Although the only good this that came from this was the little Fanny pack that I turned into a nice first aid kit. And the two pouches work good for my bug out kit. Thee actual bash holds a lot of things but I would now recommend this to any buddy.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Magaña

customer_reviews.title: Not enough Pockets inside to organize anyting
customer_reviews.text: Not enough pockets for me on the inside I had to keep digging for everything I was going to return it but just end up giving it away to someone there's definitely much better ones stonier and for cheaper
customer_reviews.author: Billy Mac

customer_reviews.title: Got a bad one
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one a couple years ago and love it, bought one for family member and Zipper came off first time zipping closed. Fail! No zipper working means not worth using or owning. We will see if they stand behind their product. When i compared zipper clasp or whatever they call it the new one is tiny and pot metal.
customer_reviews.author: JERRY WOODBURY

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack/camera bag
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my brother. He used it for school and to carry his camera. He loved that it has so many compartments.
customer_reviews.author: Linda A.

customer_reviews.title: Cool versatile backpack
customer_reviews.text: Very cool versatile backpack with two detachable pouches and satchel. However backpack is normal size but still holds quite a lot and there’s lots of pocket storage space. I used on a camping trip and it worked fine, one of the zippers broke and there’s a lot of unnecessary buckles.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Nall

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, good materials, and alot of space
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag a few months ago, and best bag ever. It is my emergency grab bag, and i have it stocked with necessary materials. The amount of space is perfect and the materials it is made out of are good quality, also the 3 pouches it comes with are detachable and all seperate from each other
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Well made but molle straps don't work
customer_reviews.text: Using this for dispersed camping. As others have said the padding on the shoulder straps is a little light. My issue that kept me from giving 4 stars is that the molle straps don't secure properly. The side pouches are a great size but I fear they'd fall off too easy with weight in them
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: I would hope that the shoulder straps would be better padded and sewed firmly to the backpack
customer_reviews.text: Product was exactly as described. For the amount of liters it can hold, I would hope that the shoulder straps would be better padded and sewed firmly to the backpack. It did not break, however, I believe any strenuous hiking with the backpack on would cause the straps to tear. Hip straps are way too high and wrap around my stomach.
customer_reviews.author: Cacauzinha

customer_reviews.title: Great buy great price
customer_reviews.text: awesome buy, a little issue on the thin, looks like it'll rip easily pocket lining. Haven't tried it out But praying it'll withstand when i fill it up. But over all great price and durability on the outside.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar Casarez

customer_reviews.title: Very, very weak bag.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it a week or so ago for school so I could take my laptop easier. Today was the first day of 11th grade. It was fine. For an hour or two. By the end of the day I'd lost three zippers. Then, I missed the bus and had to walk a few miles in over 100 degrees of heat with barely any water and no food, and carrying the bag awkwardly so I wouldn't lose all my stuff. Going to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Tactical backpack of all backpacks
customer_reviews.text: Welll.. this thing is huge! And my 3 rd grader has the largest back pack in the whole school, but... he LOVES it! I mean, he wanted a tactical backpack.... and boy does he have one... very useful. And we are happy.
customer_reviews.author: Foochiwawa

customer_reviews.title: Made very cheaply material is very thin will not withstand any rugged usethree day backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Made very cheaply material is very thin will not withstand any rugged use
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Love this back pack
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my son and he is so happy with it. Looks great. Has many compartments to stay organized. fits perfect. not heavy at all. Exactly what I expected. Thinking about buying one of my own.
customer_reviews.author: EndeArt

customer_reviews.title: Good bag, need better, more padded shoulder straps.
customer_reviews.text: Good bag, need better, more padded shoulder straps. This will do as it will be used more for daily use to and from the car and from home to work and back. Definitely need better more padded straps for this to be considered for any distance of a hike.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Great waterproof backpack for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great waterproof backpack for a cheap price. It also comes with an attachable pouch that connects to the rear bottom for extra storage. You cant beat this thing for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Svarog The Mighty

customer_reviews.title: sorry to say I'm disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box the bag looks great and I really thought this would be a top-notch item. My son loves to carry this type of backpack to school. Unfortunately it did not last the first month before the seems started to come apart. I was really shocked because he doesn't carry much just an umbrella a few spiral notebooks , binder and a water bottle!
customer_reviews.author: A Allen

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: This pack just survived its first backpacking trip, over loaded. Solid and very well made. Straps on the sides could be a little longer, but not really an issue since they are just long enough to hold my 3p tent on 1 side, sleeping bag and floor mat on the other. Only real complaint is the belt is not designed for skinny people. Unless you have a 36+ inch waist it wont give you any support. Shoulder straps are comfortable enough. And the pack distributes weight nicely
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Zipper busted on the 2nd day of use
customer_reviews.text: I like this backpack a lot but the zippers are NOT sturdy nor durable. The zipper on the side busted/snapped on the second day of use. This pack can hold a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: EDC for 3 months now!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Lots of room to organize my gear, sturdy built, comfy to carry all day. Cons: Noisy zipper tabs, had to wrap mine in duct tape, molly webbing is sub-par and cheaply made, but holds. Overall: Great product for the price, I have used this pack nearly every day for the past three months, no sign of wear or fade!
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money on this product
customer_reviews.text: Very, very poorly made. The shoulder straps on mine broke in first 2 hours of use. Do not waste your money on this product. At least it's cheap and I didn't lose much.
customer_reviews.author: Kate GM

customer_reviews.title: good pack so far
customer_reviews.text: Love his pack so far. I have gotten other packs and the plastic clips break and the backpack falls apart. I will be updating this review later when I test it. I ride motorcycle to work and home every day. I love the molle webbing on the front I was able to take some of my pouches off my tactical vest and put them here for more space (you don't need anymore space with this pack)
customer_reviews.author: michael ryan

customer_reviews.title: Wow, what a great backpack!
customer_reviews.text: This backpack has removable pockets as well as a lot of room inside of the main compartment. It also has outside pockets which is great. I use it for walk and fish trips. It holds all of my equipment with a lot of room to spare. It is big!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Wiley

customer_reviews.title: Good quality except for zippers.
customer_reviews.text: I like the storage, durable fabric, strong molle webbing, but one of the zippers to the main compartment fell off of one pack right after I received it.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. C

customer_reviews.title: Truck Bag
customer_reviews.text: I brought this bag for its price-point and space for my truck. It is my truck bag, which holds safety/emergency equipment. I am very happy with this pack.
customer_reviews.author: Avaloswrld

customer_reviews.title: A lot of space
customer_reviews.text: I carry a bunch of packs and this will hold a lot of my stuff so I do not have to worry about missing anything.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Burns

product_meta.title: CVLIFE Military Tactical Backpack Army Rucksack Assault Pack Built-up Molle Bag
product_meta.description:
Specification: 
color: Black 
Material: 600D Military oxford fabric 
Weight (approx): 1750g 
Capacity: 60L built-up
Main Compartment (approx): 19.7"(50cm) High x 13"(33cm) Wide x 8.7"(22cm) Deep 
Front Pocket (approx): 5.1"(13cm) High x 12.6"(32cm) Wide x 3.9"(10cm) Deep 
Side Pocket (approx): 7.9"(20cm) High x 4.7"(12cm) Wide x 2.4"(6cm) Deep 

Feature: 
The Backpack is constructed with waterproof 600D Nylon material. 
Come with a zipper outside pocket and a big mesh compartment in it 
With 3 detachable pouches attached on front and two sides. 
Large cargo with a big compartment in it. 
With a bite valve hole at the top of the pack, and hided by a velcro cover. 
Come with a hand carry strap and adjustable shoulder strap. 
Wide & thick waist belt, comfortable for heavy carry. 
With adjustable chest belt. 

Package Include: 
1x backpack (1x Main bag, 2 x side bags, 1x front bag)
feature_bullets: Tactical backpack is made of water- resistant 600x600 oxford fabric, water-resistant and durable.

Spacious military backpack has one main large compartment, one front DETACHABLE bag which can be used as a tactical fanny pack separately, two side DETACHABLE tactical backpack accessories pouches which can be used as first aid bags. This multipurpose backpack can be flexibly regarded as a 50L and 60L backpack.
MOLLE system of this military molle backpack rucksack allows you to easily attach outdoor gear, more pouches and sleeping pad.
Adjustable dual density ventilated mesh shoulder straps, cinching waist strap, dual compression straps, heavy duty zippers and rain diverting flaps keep your rucksack pack secure and comfortable.

This multipurpose pack can be used as a 72-hour emergency kit, range bag, hunting backpack, army camouflage backpack, 3 day assault pack, survival backpack, hiking trekking camping rucksack, and EDC outdoor backpack.
